intro: Silene schlosseri, commonly known as the "Flame Violet," is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb with showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils. Silene schlosseri is known for its distinctive pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is also a subject of scientific study due to its role in evolutionary biology and genetic research.
